channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ex-Georgia prosecutor on trial for hindering Ahmaud Arbery's murder investigation
item.description: Former district attorney Jackie Johnson is accused of interfering with the police investigation into the shooting death of Ahmaud Arbery, nearly five ...

item.title: Ohio State defeats Notre Dame 34-23 in college football championship game
item.description: Ohio State dominated most of the night, and all through the playoffs

item.title: Trump wants to pull the US out of the World Health Organization again. Here’s what may happen next
US trades Taliban prisoner for two American detainees
item.description: Two Americans held by the Taliban were exchanged for an Afghan imprisoned in the US on narco-terrorism charges.

item.title: Trump grants sweeping pardon of Jan. 6 defendants, including rioters who violently attacked police
item.description: President Donald Trump has pardoned, commuted the prison sentences or vowed to dismiss the cases of all of the 1,500-plus people charged with crimes i...

item.title: Musk responds to backlash over gesture at Trump rally
item.description: The billionaire says his critics "need better dirty tricks" after a gesture likened to a Nazi salute.

item.title: Inauguration Day in America | CBS News Special Report
item.description: CBS News brings you top moments and takeaways from President Trump's inauguration and looks ahead to his second term in office in this special report.

item.title: Beneath a veneer of calm, Trump’s inauguration holds warning signs for US democracy
Journalist shot dead, prosecutor's office bombed in Peru
item.description: Gaston Medina previously told the Committee to Protect Journalists he received death threats related to his reporting.

item.title: Ten dead in ski resort fire at Turkish hotel
item.description: At least two of the victims died after jumping from the hotel's windows, reports said.

item.title: Trump 'not confident' Israel-Gaza ceasefire will hold
item.description: The newly sworn-in US President was asked for his thoughts on the ceasefire as it enters its third day.

item.title: Fire at Turkish ski resort kills least 10 people, injures dozens more
item.description: Witnesses say guests at a ski resort hotel in Turkey tried to escape a fire that killed at least 10 people with ropes and sheets hung from windows.

item.title: Ryan Corbett's family say he's been freed in U.S.-Taliban prisoner swap
item.description: Afghanistan's Taliban government announced the release of 2 Americans in a prisoner exchange. Ryan Corbett's family says he's one of them.

item.title: Trump is withdrawing from the Paris Agreement (again), reversing U.S. climate policy
item.description: President Trump issued a barrage of orders Monday targeting Biden-era initiatives on global warming. The decisions come on the heels of the hottest ye...

item.title: Taliban announce release of two Americans held in Afghanistan in a prisoner exchange
item.description: Afghanistan's Taliban government announced on Tuesday the release of two Americans in a prisoner exchange.

item.title: PHOTOS: President Trump attends several balls to close out Inauguration Day
item.description: Trump closed out his appearances at both balls with his signature dance to the Village People's "YMCA," who performed the song live at the Liberty Bal...

item.title: South Korea president denies ordering arrest of MPs
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol has made his first appearance at an impeachment trial which will decide if he should be permanently removed.

item.title: Border Patrol agent shot dead on Vermont highway, near Canadian border
item.description: A U.S. Border Patrol agent was fatally shot on a highway in northern Vermont south of the Canadian border, authorities said.
